intro: Amyema microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of eucalyptus trees. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually less than 1 cm in length. It produces small, white or pale green flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds. Its botanical features make it an important part of the ecological interactions within its native habitat.
